sub_title: Vice-President, Global Export & International Business Development at MHP SE
summary:
SENIOR EXECUTIVE with more than 20 years’ experience in business development, general management, marketing, sales, production, and consulting. Diverse industry and functional expertise in FMCG, media, hi-tech, finance, and agriculture categories.   

Senior executive experience with reputable global companies including Kraft Foods, AB InBev, Viacom, and MHP SE.  Management and marketing consulting experience with leading international and domestic companies, including Coca-Cola, Kimberly-Clark, Carlsberg, Bongrain, Ferrero Group, Kernel Group, Renaissance Capital, AIT, and Nemiroff.  

Selected achievements:

-	At MHP SE, as the CMO responsible for corporate marketing, strategy, and new business development, led aggressive worldwide expansion of a $1.5 billion business in Europe, MENA, CIS, Africa, and Asia. Supported MHP’s growth from a local player to the second-largest poultry producer in Europe with the highest EBITDA margin in the industry. 
-	Established the European division of MHP SE, with turnover exceeding €500 million. Launched production facilities in the Netherlands and Slovakia. Developed trading companies in the Netherlands, Germany, and the UK covering 28 EU countries plus Switzerland, with sales operations. 
-	As a member of the supervisory board of Perutnina Ptuj, guided regional and international expansion of a €300 million unit, focusing on business development in Slovenia, Croatia, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Serbia, Austria, Romania, Switzerland, and Italy. Led the growth of EBITDA margin from 10% to 15% (with market average 9%).   
-	Launched MTV Ukraine, building start-up marketing and sales teams in close cooperation with MTV Europe’s headquarters in the UK. 
-	Developed and implemented a breakthrough marketing strategy at Interbrew Ukraine (now AB InBev), increasing net revenue of responsible business from $22 million (in 2000) to $105 million (in 2003), increasing EBITDA by 600%, and taking the company to first position in the market.
-	Consulted in the development of domestic and worldwide marketing strategies for a leading Ukrainian FMCG company, Nemiroff, facilitating its growth to the position of the world’s second-largest vodka brand in 2005.

school.name: Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv

profile_positions.title: Vice-President, Global Export & International Business Development

profile_positions.description: Developed and led the European division of MHP SE (a $2.1 billion LSE-listed European agricultural company focused on the production and trading of poultry products). Managed the MHP SE group of companies in Europe, including MHP B.V., EU Meatex B.V., MHP EU GmbH, and MHP East Europe S.R.O., with production facilities in six countries, representative offices in 10 countries, and annual revenue exceeding €500 million.  Established production facilities and trading companies. Led M&A activities in cooperation with investment banks (JP Morgan, Citigroup, ING) and consultancies (Deloitte, KPMG, Ernst & Young, Roland Berger, and others). Guided lobbying and GR activities in cooperation with Covington (Brussels), BCW (London), and FleishmanHillard (Amsterdam). Managed communications with representatives of industry associations, national governments, and EU governing bodies.
profile_positions.title: Vice-President, CEO Europe

profile_positions.description: Managed the marketing function. Developed and implemented corporate strategy, new business initiatives, and marketing activities. Restructured and strengthened the marketing team for “post-crisis” local challenges and international expansion. Developed and implemented a decisive global communication campaign for Qualiko (a leading MHP brand) that expanded international sales from 10 countries to more than 70, and increased export revenue from $67 million to $310 million in three years.
profile_positions.title: Chief Marketing Officer (Marketing, Strategy & New Business Development)

profile_positions.description: Led the national marketing function of a $500 million business unit. Managed six categories: chocolate, coffee, biscuits, salty snacks, gum, and candy, with 10 global brands (including Jacobs, Milka, Picnic, Dirol, Oreo) and two local brands. Grew revenue by 22% in 2011 vs 2010, successfully managing profitability through severe commodity market conditions of 2011. Managed increases of market share in all key categories. For the recently acquired gum business, grew market share from 6.9% in Feb 2011 to 13.5% in Feb 2012.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Director

profile_positions.description: Founded and led a group of Marketing agencies Rusych Communications, providing clients with ATL/BTL advertising, marketing and management consulting services. Executed consulting services for owners and senior executives of leading domestic and international companies, acting as a consultant and a marketing and sales executive. Launched MTV Ukraine, acting as its commercial director (marketing & sales). Built solid client portfolios. Provided marketing services with the group of agencies to Coca-Cola, Kimberly-Clark, Carlsberg, Bongrain, Ferrero Group, Kernel Group, Nemiroff, and more than 50 other companies.
profile_positions.title: Co-founder, Business Development Consultant & Executive

profile_positions.description: Managed beer and alcopop categories (nine brands, including Stella Artois, Beck’s, Leffe, and Chernigivske). Led the marketing team; hiring, training, coaching, supervising, and evaluating staff. Drove the development and implementation of the portfolio, innovations, communication, media, research, and pricing strategies. Planned and implemented Chernigivske’s repositioning campaign, increasing its market share from 7% in 2001 Q1 to 19% in 2004 Q1 (from 7th place to 1st in the market). Entered the white beer segment, launching a brand with a heavy IMC campaign, generating a 5% market share within 18 months in 2004 Q1. Built the world’s biggest national brand of unfiltered beers.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Manager

profile_positions.description: Managed the Flagman’s chocolate brand. Developed and implemented brand strategy and plans. Led the brand team. Developed subordinates in functional competencies. Carried out portfolio management. Managed the brand’s P&L. Developed a communication strategy. Developed and managed all trade marketing activities for the chocolate category. Increased MS of Korona chocolate tablets from 30% to 40%, and of Korona pralines from 5% to 14%. Developed a merchandising standards system for Korona that was adapted by competitors and became the market standard.
profile_positions.title: Brand Manager
